content.description:
A good warm up for the harder problems around here.

Start sitting on the far left side of the Pimpin Jeans boulder, and work yourself into an awkward mantle on the right side of the little prow. It's easier, less awkward, and similarly uneventful to finish by working up the ledges to the left (but then it's probably v0).
The slab facing Lamar and Reading Rainbow is fun, clean, and smeartastic. It's a nice first warm up for the body on a cold day.
content.location: Across from Lamar and Reading Rainbow, go up the obvious slab in the center of the face.

content.description: This awkward and shockingly uninspiring boulder starts sitting in the spiny shrubbery, and works up and to the left on the arete feature. It's over before you know it.
content.protection: No room in the shrubbery for a pad.
content.location: Across from Lamar and Reading Rainbow, look for the low sit start on the left arete.

content.description:
To the right of Roll the Dice at the entrance of the Closet from the North Trailhead.

Sit start under the small roof on a jug

and then battle the bulge.

Another great problem in the Closet circuit.

Start with your right hand on a decent sidepull/arete, and left hand on something small on the face, and work your way up the left side of the arete to the finish.
content.protection: It is tall, kind of insecure, and has a less than ideal landing. I'd say it's definitely worth it if you're certain you won't fall, or you have 3ish pads.
content.location: Right of Roll the Dice, on the same face, using the arete on the right.

content.description: Climb straight up the dimpled face. Ultra technical and a little spooky. Bad landing.
content.location: This problem is located on the boulder on the right hand side when you enter the Closet from the road.

content.description: Located on the Rainbow Boulder, Reading Rainbow begins in two shallow pockets and makes one difficult move to another bad pocket before easing off.  A one move wonder but worthwhile if you're not ready to come out of the Closet.
content.protection: Watch your back on the opposing slab behind you.
content.location: In the small cove to your left when facing the Bad Genes Boulder.

content.description: Start left on some rail then move up and top out on small crimpers in the middle.
Begin on a right-facing jug on the left side of the Bad Genes Boulder.  Move up the corner on good holds to an awkward but easy topout.  Really a pretty good problem.

The best problem to start on when you come to this area. Start standing and work up the big holds to the easy finish. It's a little spooky since the biggest holds halfway up are hollow, but they've survived a while now, so maybe they are more solid than they sound.
content.location: Right of Reading Rainbow on the orange, tan streaked rock. The boulder itself is easily found if you look left from the Pimpin Jeans boulder. Just 10 feet away.

this problem is on the huge boulder on the right of the trail from the closet area.

the problem is on the south east of the boulder.

sit start on incut crack move up left on crimps, about 8 feet then go right on to slab

content.description: Despite the name, this is a very enjoyable problem and would make a great warm-up for anyone trying to send some of the harder problems in the Closet.  Climb the face using the arete with your right hand.  It looks like a SDS has been done which would make the problem quite a bit harder.
content.protection: Spot your landing off to the left as there are some ankle twisting rocks
content.location: The obvious face to your right when facing the Bad Genes Boulder.

content.description:
A fun little climb on good rock. Start sitting with your feet high and hands in the weird pockety structure. Establish yourself on the wall, and work your way up easy steps to the left. Finish straight up with a couple of smears.

It's not very tall, but it has a bad landing. This is not a hardcore v1, however, so I wouldn't worry too much. Just jump on it, and let the warm up begin.
content.location: Left of Desperate on the Roll The Dice boulder.

content.description: Climb up the face on the sharp crimps, starting on the obvious jug. To the right of Sphere

content.location:
this problem is on the huge boulder on the right of the trail.

the problem is on the east side of the boulder.

climb up huge slab

content.description: Start far right by the little tree, then traverse left and top out on the same part as pimp in jeans.
Start as for 'Pimpin' Jeans', but trend up and right on better holds.  Much easier top-out than 'Pimpin'.
content.protection: crashpad, at most.  really flat landing, boulder isn't very high.
